channel.title: Making Public voids and booleans aren't working

item.title: Making Public voids and booleans aren't working
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You don’t need to have any returns inside of a void, unless you’re per say checking for something, if they don’t have it, you would return.

Read full topic
item.source: Making Public voids and booleans aren't working

item.title: Making Public voids and booleans aren't working
item.dc:creator: @yodudes yodudes
item.description:
@yodudes wrote:

Okay, I’ll try that. What about for voids? It still thinks that public void mineTin() { code goes here }
It wants me to put “;” after mineTin.

item.title: Making Public voids and booleans aren't working
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You have one return inside the if statement.

You need to have another one outside the statement, under the closing brace.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Public voids and booleans aren't working
item.dc:creator: @yodudes yodudes
item.description:
@yodudes wrote:

Trying to make a simple thing that repeats a fishing process. Here’s my code

public boolean shrimpfishrepeat(){ if (actionTimer == 0) { startAnimation(622); addItem(317, 1); addSkillXP(25, 10); sendMessage("You fish a shrimp"); actionTimer = 10; return true; } }

ERROR:

-MacBook-Pro: Alex$ javac *.java
client.java:19722: illegal start of expression
		public boolean shrimpfishrepeat(){
		^
client.java:19722: ';' expected
		public boolean shrimpfishrepeat(){
		                               ^
2 errors
-MacBook-Pro: Alex$

I have other booleans and voids, and they work fine, and I copy them completely, and I get those errors, can anyone help?

Read full topic
item.source: Making Public voids and booleans aren't working
